definition: to plunge into water intentionally and especially headfirst, to execute a dive (see dive entry 2 sense 1a(1))
examples: diving into the pool from the highest platform

definition: to come or drop down precipitously : plunge
to plunge one's hand into something
to plunge into some matter or activity
to plunge or dash for some place, to lunge especially in order to seize something

examples: diving one's hands into the icy water

definition: the act or an instance of diving: such as, a plunge into water executed in a prescribed manner, a submerging of a submarine, a steep descent of an airplane at greater than the maximum speed of horizontal flight
a shabby and disreputable establishment (such as a bar or nightclub)

examples: a boxer accused of taking a dive

definition: an offensive (see offensive entry 1 sense 1c) play in which the ballcarrier plunges into the line (see line entry 1 sense 7f(2)) for short yardage
